sub_title: Data / App Dev / Industrial Policy at European Space Agency
summary: I am an aerospace engineer by training with several years' experience in industrial policy analytics and programme management for the space sector through my work at the European Space Agency. I also frequently participate in technical projects and research on space activities (esp. remote sensing), data science and machine learning, and application development.

projects.title: Space4Life: Understanding animal behaviour through space data
projects.description:
The aim of this project is to correlate animal behaviour with extreme natural events. The results of this study could be useful for the protection of biodiversity and prediction of natural disasters. For instance, the results can show the shelter preferences of species in terms of evolution of a natural event (fires, hurricanes, tsunamis, etc.) In addition, detecting anomalous movements of certain animals could also improve the detection time of certain disasters.

The application was developed using Python (including Flask, Bokeh, netCDF4, pyhdf, pandas, xarray and other libraries), JavaScript and HTML and is deployed on Heroku. In addition, the satellite based data was fundamental for our project giving us the possibility of performing the correlation between events such as high precipitations and fires which can be detected through Earth observation satellites and animal movements on the land.

This project was developed as part of the NASA International Space Challenge 2020.

projects.title: Group Design Project: Remotely deployed and recovered UAV
projects.description:
Project Manager for a team of seven students representing the University of Southampton in the 2018 American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics’ (AIAA) Design Build Fly (DBF) competition. We worked in a trans-Atlantic partnership with the Air Devils team from Arizona State University to design and construct a UAV for the competition.

Following a second brief from our sponsor, Thales, we designed and flew TOTO, an autonomous UAV.

projects.title: Individual Project: Actuator Models for Wind Turbine Simulation
projects.description:
Single semester individual project with an aim to review existing literature on actuator disc models, and write up some of the background to theoretical wake interaction models. Lattice Boltzmann solvers were be used within the AMROC CFD software to study and validate several different test cases within the disc model.

Final project deliverables included a ~10,000 word report and a poster presentation to several academics at an end of semester conference.

contributors.headline: Data / App Dev / Industrial Policy at European Space Agency

projects.title: Missing Maps Southampton
projects.description:
Missing Maps Project is an open, collaborative initiative founded by Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF), the British Red Cross, the American Red Cross and the Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT).
The project involves volunteers mapping parts of the world most vulnerable to humanitarian crises, which can then be used by NGOs to carry out more efficient work in the field.

I became involved with setting up the project in Southampton through my work with Engineers Without Borders. We worked as part of a larger committee of representatives from other IDC societies in the university, namely: Friends of MSF, Unicef on Campus, British Red Cross and Cameroon Catalyst. We were also helped greatly by MSF volunteers Heather Chamberlain and Joanna Wilkin.

projects.title: Eurobot 2016 - Team SANDROID
projects.description:
Led a team of four other students (mechanical and aerospace engineering) to design and build two robots to compete in the 2016 Eurobot championship. Utilising Ultrasonic sensing systems and actuators the robots completed several point scoring tasks within a 90 minute time limit.

Our team was sponsored by both RS Components and Independent School San Luis Gonzaga.

profile_positions.description:
Akkodis (formerly Modis) for European Space Agency. Working as a member of the Industrial Return and Analytics Office, CIP-IG (formerly in the SME and Industry Analytics Section, CIP-CS and IPL-IPA). Responsible for analysis and tool development in support of ESA Industrial Policy.

Key Responsibilities:
• Development of internal web and SharePoint based applications for streamlining and automating business processes.
• Development of Tableau dashboards and analytical services required by the division concerning analysis of the European space industry.
• Analysis of ESA data sources and establishment of cooperation with data owners.
• Collection and compilation of requirements across the division, iteration with stakeholders and drafting of a development and service plan for analytical tools and services provided by the section.
• Use of Python for data processing, analysis and automation.
• Use of full stack web development languages for application development.
• Participation in key internal Working Groups and Communities of Practice regarding the future of Data Analysis and Business Intelligence at ESA.
• Organisation of Space Industry Events, including Baltic and Hungarian Space Industry Days and assistance with the 2020 ESA Industry Space Days.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Policy Support Officer

profile_positions.description:
YGT for Incentive Schemes Programme Management within the New, Cooperating and Associate States Section (Industry, Procurement and Legal Services department). Primarily responsible for the administration of ITTs and assisting in coordination with the Lithuanian delegation to ESA.

Key Responsibilities:
• Administration of Invitations to Tender for New Member States (NMS), Cooperating States (PECS) and Associate States including coordination and assignment of proposals to expert reviewers, and preparing presentations to NMS delegations.
• Evaluation of technical proposals received for PECS calls in multiple countries.
• Liaison with the Lithuanian government delegation to ESA on matters relating to the Lithuania PECS, including preparation of an End of PECS Country Report.
• Organisation of training events and briefings to industry, including a Business-to-Business event in Latvia.
• Development of database and management tools in Excel using functionalities such as VBA programming, Power Query and Pivot Tables.
profile_positions.title: Young Graduate Trainee (Incentive Schemes Programme Management)

profile_positions.description:
Primarily working within the Renewables & Sustainability department, I contributed to several different large and small scale renewable energy projects. These included:

• Estimating and mapping heating and hot water usage in the town of Porthleven, Cornwall for a community heating feasibility study.
• Contributions to multiple feasibility studies and project tenders for community energy projects.
• Drafting Transport Management and Worker Accommodation Plans for the world's largest new Solar PV project in Benban, Egypt.
• Irradiation studies and Operational Analysis for several Solar Farms across the UK, including site visits to gather data.

Throughout these projects I enhanced my skills in teamwork, data handling, technical report writing and renewable energy research.
profile_positions.title: Intern (Renewables & Sustainability)

profile_positions.description:
Working at the National Centre for Advanced Tribology (nCATS) within the Engineering and Environment department. Assisting with metallographic investigation of white etching cracks (WECs) in wind turbine gearbox bearing steels as part of a study on the influence of lubricants on WEC mechanisms. Research sponsored by Afton Chemical.

Experience with various materials lab equipment and identifying WECs on bearing segments, as well as organising data and keeping track of experiments.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Architecture, engineering and management consultants.
1 week work experience placement at London office in various departments including Planning, Costing, Transport, Structures, Sports, Mechanical & Engineering.

volunteer_experiences.role: Data Scientist, Application Developer and Hardware Design
volunteer_experiences.description:
Current flood monitoring systems generally rely heavily on model-based forecasting such as Ensemble Forecasting (Wu et al., 2020), while active monitoring is limited to human/aircraft reporting and static sensor measurements. All of these methods have the disadvantage of not being able to track both the live movement and the conditions of the flood waters directly.

Our UVP addresses this with “Transparent Emergency Awareness through Distributed Geolocation Data”. This refers to the capability of our solution to track and process both the flooding and water quality evolution in real-time from our beacon system using machine learning algorithms, giving a more complete picture of the flood event as it develops than currently available and allowing for better decision making during the event.

Our solution architecture allows the movement characterisation of the flood including its velocity and direction by using GNSS from Galileo, GPS, and QZSS constellations while receiving and processing EWS messages broadcast by QZSS (and Galileo in the future).

SGNAVI has already created a successful PoC for this solution and has been awarded the Michibiki prize in the MGA RPD Challenge 2020 Extended and 2nd finalist for the Galileo Masters Comunidad de Madrid Prize 2021.

More details can be found here:
• https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jcSKIlAAP7Q
• https://qzss.go.jp/en/events/rpd-challenge_210917.html
• https://www.madrimasd.org/notiweb/noticias/detektia-cetra-base-ganadores-copernicus-galileo-masters-comunidad-madrid-2021

AIOFAR’s aim is to improve ocean farming performance by studying the feasibility of farms based on the selected area and monitoring threads that can affect already existing ocean farms such as harmful algal blooms, ocean acidification and harsh weather conditions. This goal is achieved by analysing several sources of input data: multispectral images and marine data parameters from Copernicus program, positioning information from GNSS satellites, in-situ data obtained through deployed IoT devices, and feasibility databases from specialised organisations. All this data is evaluated using artificial intelligence and other advanced processing techniques.

Webpage: https://aiofar.com/

Volunteer in the March 2021 weekend DataDive, working on the challenge topic of housing insecurity in the United States. I conducted exploratory data analysis to find correlations between eviction rates and other housing insecurity data with socioeconomic census data in Hillsborough County, FL and NYC, NY. I created two Tableau Public Workbooks and a Jupyter Notebook to facilitate this data exploration and allow correlations to be compared between the two locales.

• https://github.com/datakind/Mar21-housing-insecurity/tree/main/scripts/_zrowland885
• https://public.tableau.com/profile/zrowland#!/vizhome/DataKindMar21-housing-insecurityExplorer/Dash
• https://public.tableau.com/profile/zrowland#!/vizhome/DataKindMar21-housing-insecurityCorrelationResults/Dash

Led a committee to re-establish the Southampton branch of EWB-UK. Primarily responsible for designating tasks to other committee members, organizing projects and trips for members, and working with local charities and EWB-UK to further our development goals.

Projects and events organised in 2015/16

• Organising EWB Southampton’s map sessions for the MSF Missing Maps Project. Volunteers are trained to use Open Street Map to map areas affected by disease and natural disasters for medical staff working on the ground.
• Pictorial Tool Maintenance Manuals for TFSR use in the developing world. These will be used in areas with low literacy rates or where translation is impractical.
• Trips to the TFSR workshop to undertake refurbishment work and volunteering.
• Design and construction of a reliable, low cost slow sand water filter to introduce students to international development work and provide an example of the work carried out by EWB-UK.
• Social events with Lawyers Without Borders and other societies.

Worked to ensure a healthy transition of EWB Southampton from the founder committee to an independent future. Primarily responsible for fundraising of projects and managing committee funds. Also fulfilling some events coordinator roles as a stand-in for the position, by planning socials and trips.

I was responsible for organising the Southampton Hub Sustainability Festival, a day long interactive conference run annually by members of Southampton Hub. It aims to raise awareness about sustainability and all that it encompasses, along with encouraging students to take action.

My role involved recruiting and managing our guest speakers, as well as securing funding from O2 Think Big.

Webpage: http://www.southamptonhub.org/sustainability-festival
Responsible for moving new students into their halls of residence, ensuring their safety and giving correct directions and information.
Volunteer Steward at Bestival 2014 for Oxfam.
